title: Average Velocity Equation
text: If s(t) is the position of an object moving along a coordinate axis, the average velocity of the object over a time interval [a,t] is $$V_{avg}=\frac{s\left(t\right)-s\left(a\right)}{t-a}$$
speech: If s(t) is the position of an object moving along a coordinate axis, the average velocity of the object over a time interval [a,t] is    v sub a v g end sub is equal to fraction, s of t minus s of a, over, t minus a,

title: Plugging In
text: In this question, $$t$$ goes from $$2$$ to $$2+h$$. Plug $$2+h$$ in $$t$$ and $$2$$ in a for the previous equation.
speech: In this question,  t  goes from  2  to  2, plus h . Plug  2, plus, h  in  t  and  2  in a for the previous equation.
pacedSpeech: in a for the previous equation.

title: Expanding Powers of Three
speech: The equation for  parentheses a plus b,  cubed  is  a cubed plus 3 a to the b-th, plus, 3 times a b squared, plus b cubed .
pacedSpeech: The equation for    a plus b,  cubed
is   a cubed plus 3 a to the b-th, plus, 3 times a b squared, plus b cubed
